alert.note: Alert for Cooper (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 04 at 8:27PM CDT until August 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Cooper County in central Missouri... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 826 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Bunceton, or near Tipton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cooper County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
